intro: Scaevola saligna f. intermedia, commonly known as the silverleaf scaevola, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a compact shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small, clustered in showy inflorescences, and are usually blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in coastal landscaping due to its salt tolerance and drought resistance.
